intro: Tupistra nagarum, commonly known as the sacred mountain plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Himalayan regions of India and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by the development of small, triangular fruits. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tupistra nagarum is often found in rocky and mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and moist environments.
